revised_title: Exploring the Cause of QuickSilver's Suspended Phenomenon in Torricellian Experiments
tldr: M. Hugens investigates the cause of quicksilver remaining suspended above the usual height in Torricellian experiments. He suggests that a subtle matter, more potent than air, contributes to the pressure that keeps the quicksilver suspended. This hypothesis is supported by three experiments, including a siphon experiment that refutes the concept of fuga vacui.
